attributes.description: The system context identifies the physical context (the environment and external systems your system interacts with) enabling you to specify the system boundary.
Ground segment enables management of a spacecraft, and distribution of payload data and telemetry among interested parties on the ground. ::::Source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ground_segment
Provide radio interfaces between space and ground segments for telemetry, tracking, and command, as well as payload data transmission and reception.

Mission control centers process, analyze, and distribute spacecraft telemetry, and issue commands, data uploads, and software updates to spacecraft. For crewed spacecraft, mission control manages voice and video communications with the crew. Control centers may also be responsible for configuration management and data archival. As with ground stations, there are typically backup control facilities available to support continuity of operations.

Remote terminals are interfaces on ground networks, separate from the mission control center, which may be accessed by payload controllers, telemetry analysts, instrument and science teams, and support personnel, such as system administrators and software development teams. They may be receive-only, or they may transmit data to the ground network.

requirementTarget.name: Maintain Data on Events and Failures

attributes.description: Ground networks handle data transfer and voice communication between different elements of the ground segment. These networks often combine LAN and WAN elements, for which different parties may be responsible. Geographically separated elements may be connected via leased lines or virtual private networks. The design of ground networks is driven by requirements on reliability, bandwidth, and security.

attributes.documentOverview: The European FireRS project aims the early detection of fires, as::well as their monitoring and continuous follow-up in order to provide::real data to emergency systems. It brings together three elements::that make up the system::: Ground sensors.:: A satellite that collects data from sensors.:: Software for predicting the progress of the fire.
attributes.description: wildFIRE Remote Sensing (FIRE-RS) Concept of Operations::::https://github.com/coordinated-systems-lab/cube-sat/blob/main/common/lume-1-cubesat-case-study-updated.pdf

http://emits.sso.esa.int/emits-doc/ESTEC/AO-1-5522_Space-System-Design_PhaseA_AnnexA.pdf::The IRIS system will be used for improved air traffic management across Europe (makes use of satellites to enhance communication and efficiency): ::https://www.esa.int/Applications/Telecommunications_Integrated_Applications/Iris_for_aviation::http://esamultimedia.esa.int/docs/telecom/Iris.pdf::The requirements document provides a useful jumping off point for establishing general system requirements for the CubeSat, independent of final payload.

requirementTarget.name: Maintain Data on Events and Failures

attributes.description: The GST shall have antennas (receiving and transmitting) that satisfy the necessary radio frequency requirements (VHF, UHF, S-band, etc.) for that terminals tasks.
The GST antenna gain (system receive sensitivity) shall use circular polarization.
The GST antenna shall be between 3-6m long (depending on gain needed).
The GST shall have antenna rotators that can carry the weight and momentum of the selected antennae.
The GST antenna rotators shall keep the antenna beam aligned with the satellites direction using an elevation-over-azimuth design.
The GST shall have a diplexer to connect the antenna to the receiver and transmitter and has the necessary filtering to prevent the transmitter from interfering with the receiver.

The GST shall have a transmitter that modulates the input signal collection, up-converts it to the uplink frequency/protocol, and amplifies it to the transmitters selected operating point through the terminal antenna.

The GST transmitter will undergo digital processing which involves:::Individual signals from the data source being modulated to form the components of the data streams::Combining these streams using a multiplexer to form the baseband uplink stream
The GST shall have a receiver that can demodulate the input signals into its components that includes TT&C data, ranging signals, command authentication, and mission data.
The GST shall process, disseminate, and store the data received from the satellite in a method that is deemed appropriate for mission goals/purpose.
The GST shall implement the telemetry, tacking and command (TT&C) functions with the satellite
The GST shall communicate with the satellite using the band selected for fixed links communication (TBC)
The GST shall provide ranging measurements of the satellite(s)

The GST shall extract the telemetry parameters from the satellite telemetry channel and perform the following functions: Parameter monitoring, Parameter calibration, Parameter integrity and validity check, State interpretation,Second order parameter calculations
The GST shall support the following telecommand functions: Command generation and automation, Command pre-transmission validation, Command transmission, Post-execution verification
The GST shall be able to manage the on-board generation and downlink of telemetry data
The GST shall allow hardware, software and firmware upgrades during the mission lifetime
The GST shall be able to perform on-board software management functions
The GST shall be able to perform on-board scheduling management functions
The GST shall derive performance metrics based on the signal strength measurements retrieved from the GES

The GST performance metrics shall derive in: Notifications/warnings/alarms displayed to the satellite operators, Automatic execution of satellite recovery procedures, Historical archiving of satellite and communications payload performance metrics
The GST shall include Network Management functions to support status monitoring and control of the control segment
The GST systems shall present a common Graphical User Interface (GUI)
The GST shall display satellite and payload parameters
The GST shall be synchronized with UTC time
The GST shall use UTC time to timestamp events, alarms, schedules, time parameters and database updates
The GST shall implement authentication and authorization operator mechanisms
The GST shall restrict the user rights according to the user profile
The GST management system shall be operated on standard PC platforms
The GST architecture shall be sized for a single satellite but it shall be designed to be scalable to support up to TBD satellites
It shall be possible to deploy GST capabilities progressively
The telemetry system shall support simultaneous channels
The telemetry downlink shall support data rates of at least 2 bps (TBC)
The telemetry downlink signal quality shall have a BER (bit errors) better than 10^-6
The GST shall support the retrieval of telemetry parameter data less than 10 (TBC) days old in less than 10 (TBC) seconds
The telecommand uplink shall support data rates of at least 2 bps (TBC)
The GST shall require no more than one operator for nominal spacecraft and ground segment operations
The GST shall support off-line operations preparation and support tasks
The GST shall maintain historical data of telemetry and telecommand for a period of at least 5 years (TBC)
The GST shall consist of two centers, one active + one back-up GST in stand-by mode installed at a different location (TBC)
The GST shall support satellite re-configuration functions
The GST shall operate 24 hours per day, 7 days per week throughout its operational lifetime
The GST shall allow hardware, software and firmware upgrades during the mission lifetime
The GST shall allow fallback mechanisms in case of failure during system upgrade procedure
Any system upgrade shall be minimize the impact upon on-going mission operations or procedures
The GST shall support satellite attitude orbit determination based on ranging measurements and tracking data
The GST shall support attitude monitoring based on telemetry data
The GST shall support satellite attitude control commands transmitted on telecommand messages to perform the necessary changes and maneuvers
The GST shall support orbit propagation and determination of orbital events (e.g. eclipses, sensor blindings)
The GST shall support satellite physical state determination
The GST shall have a mean availability better than 99.99% (TBC)
The MTBF (mean time between failures) of the GST hardware shall be better than TBD hours
The GST shall support the display of current and historical spacecraft status

identity.name: Maintain Data on Events and Failures

attributes.description: The GST shall support an event/failure historical data file for a minimum period of TBD months
The GST event/failure history file shall be updated upon operator command (manually) or automatically according to periodic update commands
The GST event/failure history file format shall be text format
The GST network management system shall allow displaying the configuration of any network element and modify it
The GST network management system shall allow: Adding hardware, Deleting hardware, Create, modify and delete parameters, Map parameters to network elements
The GST management system shall allow retrieving performance data from any managed equipment
The GST management system shall maintain historical performance data of all managed network elements
The GST shall provide ephemeris data in WGS 84 (World Geodetic System)
The validity period of ephemeris data shall be greater than TBD days
The new ephemeris data shall be transmitted to the NMC at least TBD days before expiry time of the previous ephemeris data
The ephemeris accuracy shall be better than TBD Km with respect to the real satellite position for all nominal mission lifetime

requirementTarget.name: Historical Maintenance of Alarms and Events

attributes.description: The GST shall create a duplicated alarm and event data file which shall be periodically sent to the back-up GST
The GST fault management functions shall cover: Alarm reception/periodic retrieval and display, Status display, History file display, Automatic alarm recovery/healing functions
The GST shall display all alarms received from GST managed network elements in a text format
The GST shall support all alarms received from GST managed network elements with audio flags and reminders

All alarms received from GST managed network elements shall be displayed showing: Network element identified, Network element sub-system identified, Occurrence time and date, Alarm criticality and severity level, Description, Probable cause, Alarm state (pending, acknowledged or terminated)
The GST fault management system shall include a alarm log file
The GST alarm log file shall be maintained for a minimum period of TBD months
The alarms shall be classified in the following categories according to its criticality: Critical, Major, Minor, Warning, Indeterminate
The alarms shall be classified according to the following states: pending, acknowledged and terminated
The GST shall support alarm filtering and sorting according to several criteria
The GST shall support alarm clearing for terminated and acknowledged alarms

identity.name: Historical Maintenance of Alarms and Events

attributes.description: The GST shall maintain a history file of cleared and acknowledged events and alarms
The SOC architecture shall be sized for a single satellite but it shall be designed to be scalable and support up to TBD satellites
It shall be possible to deploy SOC capabilities progressively
The SOC shall be designed for a minimum lifetime of 15 years
The SOC shall allow fallback mechanisms in case of failure during system upgrade procedure
Any system upgrade shall be minimize the impact upon on-going mission operations or procedures
The SOC shall have a mean availability better than 99.99% (TBC)
The MTBF (mean time between failures) of the SOC hardware shall be better than TBD hours
The SOC shall operate 24 hours per day, 7 days per week throughout its operational lifetime
The SOC shall provide satellite pointing correction mechanism
The SOC shall support communication payload re-configuration functions.
The SOC shall support maneuver planning including: E-W station keeping and relocation, N-S station keeping and de-orbiting at end of life

The SOC shall include a satellite database consisting of: orbital parameter database, satellite specific information including configuration, mass property, fuel information, sensor information, thrusters information, etc., command script files required for nominal and contingent operations, telemetry display files including conversion coefficients, derived telemetry parameters and formulas, ranging parameters, etc.
The CC shall executed the mission schedule provided by mission management by converting the commands into a program-specified data format for up-linking to the space segment.
The CC shall received the telemetry data from the space segment and monitor the state-of-health (SOH) of the satellite and payload.
The CC shall send commands to the appropriate ground terminal regarding where to point and start listening for the space segment at a certain time in the scheduled contact period.
The SOC shall support the archiving and retrieval of operations procedures and schedules history for a minimum period of TBD
There shall be a means of disseminating the final data-products to the authorized users (TBD).

There shall be a process, depending on the mission payload/nature of the data collected (TBD), to transform the raw space segment data collected into a product that is suitable for use by the end user.
There shall be a means of storing the collected data in a secure manner (storage method TBD, possible to store non-sensitive information in the cloud).
The SOC shall provide the following functionality: Operations and mission planning, Operations automation and execution, and Operations validation

The SOC shall support spacecraft operations during the following phases: Pre-launch phase, Early operations phase (EOP) and commissioning phase, Routine operations, Emergency operations, De-orbiting at end-of-life
The SOC shall support automatic operations at different levels: Manual operations and procedures, Scheduled operations and procedures, Contingency detection and recovery

The SOC shall conduct the following management of scheduled operations: Suspend and resume scheduled operations, Insert, modify and delete scheduled operations, Archiving, retrieval, display and redefine operation procedures

The SOC shall support the following initiation of operations procedures: Manual initiation, Automatic scheduled operation procedure according to pre-defined operational plan, Automatic scheduled operation procedure in response to events
The SOC procedure execution shall allow the satellite operators to visualize operation procedures and schedules, introduce input data, and modify operations parameters.
The SOC shall be based to the maximum extent on COTS (commercial-off-the-shelf) equipment
The SOC shall support authentication and authorization operator mechanisms to prevent unauthorized access.
The SOC shall use UTC time to timestamp events, alarms, schedules, operations, time parameters and database updates
The GST network management system shall use simple network management protocol (SNMP)
The SOC shall restrict the user rights according to the user profile
The SOC shall support the scheduling of activities for automated execution
The SOC shall support the planning of operations up to 4 months
The SOC shall support the scheduling of automated operations up to 2 weeks
The SOC shall show: status of running activities, schedule display, completed tasks of the running activity, procedure summary display, procedure detail display
The SOC shall include a tool for planning and preparation of operations
The SOC planning and preparation tool shall support input, output and editing of operations procedures
